title: Dual matroid
summary: In matroid theory, the dual of a matroid M {\displaystyle M} is another matroid M âˆ— {\displaystyle M^{\ast }} that has the same elements as M {\displaystyle M} , and in which a set is independent if and only if M {\displaystyle M} has a basis set disjoint from it.[1][2][3]
